path: artifacts/GoingApe - Smart Contract Audit Final Report.pdf

project_path.nft-smart-contract: contracts/GoingApe - Smart Contract Audit Final Report/nft-smart-contract

findings.title: Maximum mint amount for Private and Public Sales do not match the intended design.
findings.description: The maximum mint limit for private and public sales should be 5 and 3 respectively, but it was found to be 10 and 5 in the contract.

findings.title: Strict Equality should be avoided in Require Statements
findings.description: The require statements contain a strict equality check that ensures msg.value being passed during the transaction is exactly equal to purchase amount.

findings.title: Violation of Check_Effects_Interaction Pattern in Mint functions
findings.description: The state variables were updated after the external calls are being made.

findings.title: No Events emitted after imperative State Variable modification
findings.description: Functions that update an imperative arithmetic state variable do not emit an event.

findings.title: External Visibility should be preferred
findings.description: Some functions with public visibility can be marked as external for gas optimization.
findings.location: Various functions in the GoingApeSigVerifyNft contract

findings.title: Absence of Error messages in Require Statements
findings.description: The withdrawBalance() function contains a require statement that doesnâ€™t involve any error messages.

findings.title: Unlocked Pragma statements found in the contracts
findings.description: The contracts included unlocked pragma solidity version statements.

findings.title: Test Cases need to be modified and fixed
findings.description: The test cases designed for the current contract structure fail at particular instances.
